citation.article-title: Eight new species of the genus Micromonospora, Micromonospora citrea sp. nov., Micromonospora echinaurantiaca sp. nov., Micromonospora echinofusca sp. nov. Micromonospora fulviviridis sp. nov., Micromonospora inyonensis sp. nov., Micromonospora peucetia sp. nov., Micromonospora sagamiensis sp. nov., and Micromonospora viridifaciens sp. nov.

p.s: (e.chin.au.ran.ti’a.ca. Gr. n. echinos sea urchin, N. L. fem.adj. aurantiaca orange-colored, N. L. fem. adj. echinauranticaca spiny and orange colored)
Color of substrate mycelium is signal orange (RAL 2010) on media ISP 2, 4 and 6, deep orange (RAL 2011) on ISP 3 and pastel yellow (RAL 1034) on ISP.

Positive (APIZym) for esterase (C4), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, naphtol-AS-Bi-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, and N-acetyl-β-glucoseamidase.

Positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C8), phosphatase acid and α-glucosidase; negative for lipase (C14), chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, and β-glucosidase, β-glucoronidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
Peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid; diagnostic sugars are xylose, glucose and rhamnose; MK-9 (H4) is the principal menaquinone; diagnostic phospholipid is phosphatidylethanolamine.
